parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps remotely derived from the base of basis; to lift, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
